content: BNE-NRT connecting to Sapporo. Aircraft from Brisbane cramped with seats close together. Had to sit with legs apart as knees hit seat in front and am only 170cm (5'7"). FA friendly helpful and English speaking. Food disappointing. Hot meal was OK but snack consisted of stale multigrain bread with ham and plastic cheese with mustard pickle reminiscent of your school sandwiches. Obviously need better catering in Brisbane. Domestic connection in Narita was good. Seats better - less cramped. Efficient FA. Fares however cheaper than rival airlines so value for money.

Late night flight to Narita fully loaded 777. Despite the cramped seat pitch across their fleet I have enjoyed flying JAL. The service has been very warm efficient and polite. However the catering on this particular flight left a lot to be desired. After take off and waiting for a little over an hour - smiling flight attendants doled out a drink of choice and two small cookies. That was it - till breakfast was served a few hours later - no choice just the standard very bland congee. Also having flown on JAL the previous month having watched most of the movies available - I was a bit disappointed to find the selection of movies almost identical on this flight. So tried to catch up on sleep instead but with a short flight time breakfast was served about 4.30am. so not much sleep either. While not the best flight I've had with them I still would fly with them again - perhaps not a red eye like this one. Hope they get that cash injection from somewhere soon.

SIN-NRT. 11pm flight and the aircraft was extremely warm to the extent that we were sweating. 1 hour into the flight we were still waiting for our refreshments. We were only served a piece of cookie and a drink. This left us thirsty throughout the flight.

Singapore to KL on B767-300 in Y class. Managed to get a good deal from Zuji website for S$103 including taxes (return). Travelled with family and 2 kids. Were given bulkhead seats on both sectors. Singapore-Kl was about 40% full. Flight was from KIX with a stopover in Singapore. Thus managed to get some seats from the back with my infant daughter. Was given packet of apple juice and disposable wet wipes. FA polite and offered more wet wipes when they saw me having a sandwich. Flight map shown during the flight. KL to Singapore was about 60% full a newer B767-300. Cushions were thinner compared to ANA Y Class. Don't think it would be comfortable for a flight for more than 6 hrs to KIX due to thin cushions. Overall flight was comfortable for a short flight and a bargain.

Rome to Tokyo. For a 12 hour flight it was very reasonable. Its fortunate I got an exit row seat otherwise I think I would have died. Im 6ft 5 and pretty thin so the width of the seat didn't bother me but if you are even slightly overweight I think you would find the seats uncomfortable. Service of staff on JAL is exceptional they are so wonderful happy and willing to help. This was a night flight but I didn't sleep. Also the inflight entertainment is woefully inadequate by today standards. Movies & TV shows are not on demand you have to wait until the movie/tv show restarts - very frustrating on a long haul flight. Probably wont fly again if it can be avoided.

London Heathrow - Tokyo - Sydney. My first time in JAL as I had booked a FF Award seat on QF (LHR-SYD) and it turned out it was on JAL. Easy check-in great lounge. Service on board was better than I expected - B777-300ER on leg 1 B777-200 on leg 2. Very nice Japanese food possibly the best I have eaten in Economy. Great FAs happy to do their best to help with our young child. Ample legroom and happy to serve food out of normal service times if required. Very good first experience overall.

LHR-NRT-LHR booked economy only to get upgraded to business as economy was full with a lot of group bookings. Was lucky enough to get a bulkhead seat in business which had great legroom. Lie flat seats were excellent. Food was the best I have had on an airline and drink available at all times. Flight crew very attentive.

NRT-SFO on B777-300ER with the new first class suites. The food was phenomenal and service was second to none. The cabin crew made me feel welcome and they took care of every little need. They were so polite and willing. I have flown every class on JAL and I would recommend it.

BNE-NRT Discount Business Class Fare to connect to Finnair flights to Europe. Meticulous service with good food and wine. B767-300 showing its age a little and as the business cabin was full I had a sense of claustrophobia. I recall JAL used to operate larger B747-400s on this run until a year or so ago so it would be nice to see this type of larger type of aircraft or similar used on this route again. Nevertheless an excellent flight with superb service.

BNE-NRT-BNE both sectors on aged B767-300 operated by Jalways crew. The cabin seats 6 abreast which felt too cramped for a business experience - seats are showing their age with limited functionality and no better than a domestic business class or international premium economy seat. Adequate for daytime flight only. The Magic-III inflight entertainment system worked - however I was disappointed by the range and selection of movies available. The in-flight service differed dramatically. On our flight to Narita we had a wonderful crew led by a Thai-based purser - hard working always in the cabin and a wonderful inflight experience which made up for the substandard cabin. On our return it was the opposite. The service was chaotic and disorganised. The business cabin was full and it was over 2 hours after boarding before we were even offered a drink. This is an overnight flight departing Narita ~2130 so the entire meal service should have been completed by 2 hours into the flight to ensure we had sufficient time to rest. However we hadn't even been offered a drink. We were exhausted after travelling in from Los Angeles so my partner walked down to the galley and requested a snack and a bottle of water. This was promptly provided for us but you could tell our request was not appreciated. The cabin temperature was hot during both flights and the air quality seemed stuffy and overly dry. Requests to lower the air temperature was denied as I was quoted "that the Japanese passengers feel the cold". Overall if flying JAL again on this route I would save the money and fly economy.

Nagoya - Bangkok return. JAL offered very good prices for the 6 hour trip so that was the main reason it was chosen over Thai Airways. The flight to Bangkok was an early evening flight which was quite reasonable. The plane was clean and recently refurbished updated IFE and new covers for economy seats. We ordered the vegetarian meal which was reasonable. The seats were newer and wider which was a vast improvement on the older planes JAL still uses. Service was fine when you asked for it but FAs were not very attentive. IFE was fine and had some good movies. The plane on the return journey was much older seats older and narrower design. Not very comfortable but had plenty of leg space as my wife and I got exit seats. This flight was overnight and we got little sleep and didn't eat anything as we were too tired. My wife was feeling queasy for the whole flight but the FA who was sitting opposite us went beyond the call of duty and constantly asked if there was anything she could do to make my wife more comfortable - she gave us extra blankets and chatted to us during the flight.

Narita-Amsterdam return B777-200ER. Boarding very smooth at both airports. Inflight service reasonable though flight attendants used very basic even rude English with customers whom they believed could not use Japanese which was a sharp contrast to the elegant Japanese used with Japanese passengers. The economy class seats are terrible unless you are a dwarf. They do not properly recline. The seat slides forward as the back reclines so the legs hit the seat in front: quite unsuitable for a 12-hour flight. Magic III was fair with a rather limited selection available.

JAL roundtrip from Chicago to Tokyo last week. I could not believe the 777-300ER had no individual ventilation system per seat. Whatever the reason the result is that the economy section was extraordinarily hot and stuffy where my daughter and I were sitting - to the point where she got sick and had a mild asthma attack. For 12 hours I was sweating with no relief. The return plane was a bit better but very uneven. It would cool down only to get hot again for 45 minute stretches. Several passengers including myself complained about the poor ventilation and A/C. I walked all over the economy section and noticed that as I walked down an aisle I could literally feel the temperature change - the uneven cooling was that noticeable. JAL flight attendants heading to Narita were very sweet to my daughter who had to sit in the jump seat in the galley as it was significantly cooler. On the way back to Chicago the flight attendant I complained to who was serving our side of the economy section was rather argumentative saying some passengers complained they were cold and had extra blankets. Well hardly anyone in economy had them as it was easy to check. I called her out and asked her to prove this and then she shut up. I happened to casually chat with 3 other passengers on this leg who also complained about the atrocious ventilation/temperature. What is going on here? JAL's food is pretty bad and the section is cramped but I got what I paid for so no complaints. They were very efficient in their service all around even if the food was awful and the red wine I got had actually turned into vinegar. I shall never fly them again.

Sydney-Narita B777. Staff fantastic both on the ground and in the air. Japanese and Western choice for meal noodles during the flight and snack before landing. I'm 6' and was able to stretch out in the seat however the seat was a little hard. We got an excellent companion deal which made it excellent value even compared to several premium economy fares.

Japan Airlines Sydney-Tokyo return. The flight is operated by Japan Airlines on behalf of Jalways. The service is polite and graceful. We travelled Premium Economy Class and there was always staff on hand to assist or offer you a drink soup or snack. Premium Economy seats are quite comfortable and have large tables. The meal service (the same as normal economy class) in both directions was good. I think they need a few more new release movies on their AVOD system and another inch or two of legroom so that it easier to slide out into the aisle when sitting at a window or middle seat.

Chicago to Narita which was a very nice flight all things considered. The food was good service was good and although there was not tons of leg room I was comfortable enough (I am only 5' 2"). The way back to Chicago from Narita was a nightmare. I had a seat next to my husband and all was fine at first till the Asian woman in front of me reclined her seat over halfway. On the flight there I had mine reclined about 1" and when asked by a Stewardess to move it for the man behind me I did even though it was not mealtime. This woman would not move at all and the Stewardess would do nothing and even as a short person I was uncomfortably cramped. I asked the woman and the Stewardess for help but was ignored by the woman and told by the Stewardess she could do nothing. Then mealtime came they made her move and after the meal I put my pillow against the window and went to sleep. When I woke up (because I was in pain) her seat was all the way reclined and my legs were all cramped up. I asked her and the stewardess again with no result. I finally went and stood in the back of the plane and refused to sit in that seat unless the woman moved. I talked to the Stewardess explained that when asked to move I did explained I was in pain and said I paid just as much for my ticket as the other inconsiderate woman did. After standing there about 20 minutes they finally gave me a seat on the other side of the plane (which was a lot more roomy and the people over there were considerate). Nothing would have been done had I not forced the issue and I did not appreciate being treated that way. I will not fly JAL again not even in a higher class that was hands down the worst experience I ever had on a plane. I guess it is a value price if you don't mind being exceedingly uncomfortable for 14 long hours but I do mind. They only get a 5 because my flight one way was good but it is still a 50/50 gamble.

Jakarta - Tokyo economy class. Check in excellent at CGK. Onboard comfortable with friendly and excellent FAs. For the 7 hour flight I think this flight needs more food and drink. IFE was old fashioned and small selection of movies and music.

NRT-CDG in Y class on B777-300ER. Crew offered good service with a good response. Seats were cramped. My feet touched the next seats which is not comfortable for 12+ hour trip. Food quantity and quality is seriously decreasing comparing to a few years ago. Entertainment OK with AVOD system.

BKK-NRT on B767. Check in good but the lounge was not. Very small and cramped with the smoking room door opened. The flight was fine. Service pleasant and the food good although small in portion. Drink service and midflight snack was also on the small side. Seats fairly comfortable for the 5+ hour flight.

Brisbane to London via Narita. Economy class and service was excellent and polite. Great food and drink service and IFE superb. Departing Narita we asked the English flight attendant for Scotch and Dry which she duly delivered but warned us that if we wanted another drink of the same to order it from her as apparently Dry Ginger Ale is not available to Economy passengers and none of the Japanese crew would serve it to us! Strange - does Dry Ginger cost more than lemonade? Osaka to Brisbane we made sure we bought a bottle of Canada Dry to have with our inflight Scotch!

HKG-HND/NRT-HKG during the holiday period. Flights on time and crew friendly. Crew were not strict with safety regulations - passengers roaming round with seat belt sign on or using footrest during take-off and landing were ignored by crew who saw what was happening. Food was horrible. I'm no fussy eater but it was not appealing. I have never seen such small meals served for a 4 hr flight.

LHR - NRT return B777-300 Executive class. Flight to Tokyo was on the warm side as JAL flights often are. Choice of films OK but I expected more top billing films - the programme was padded out by many old or b movie films. Food good but as always a bit limited in choice Beef or Fish never anything else! JAL shell seats do not recline flat which is comfortable at first but you find yourself slowly sliding downwards - good for 2 or 3 hours sleep. Return flight much the same a pleasant experience with excellent service from flight attendants.
NRT-SGN. Good movie options very friendly and professional staff. My first time with them totally recommend.

Paris-Tokyo in business. Check in was fast handled by Air France. Check in staff nice but refused to issue my onward boarding pass with Cathay Pacific (their oneworld partner) to Taipei but a staff in JAL uniform apologized. Seat is not a flat bed not comfortable at all as you slide down and entertainment system is old and choice very limited. Crew very polite and food is good both quality and quantity. Very strange though that they put some British cabin crew that do not speak French on Paris flights. As I cannot sleep I was working and the crew kept on refilling with tea and snack. All in all an excellent service but the uncomfortable seat and poor entertainment drags it down a lot.

NRT-PVG-NRT. B767 outbound and B737 inbound. Old 767 aircraft but exit row so a lot of legroom. PTV on 767 is small. Meal good and crew were helpful and attentive. I was on a new 738 on my inbound flight - cabin was not spacious but seat was comfortable. Huge personal screen with high resolution service good.

SIN-NRT HND-SIN. SIN-NRT on a relatively new 767-300 in immaculate condition and service was great. The biggest welcome was big touch screen monitors on every seat - movies and selections were up to date. Cabin crew constantly walking up and down the aisle. Return trip was via Haneda. Same aircraft similar service provided for the overnight flight. I would consider flying on JAL again after this great and positive experience.

LAX-PVG. LAX to NRT was not as expected from Japan Airlines seat on business class was not a flat bed and being 6'2 is not a good one to sit. They don't have amenity in a bag like other business class but in a basket and FA goes around and let you pick which one you want and all wrap in a cheaply plastic . Food were served in a bento box looks nice in pictures but not in real food really disappointed. Love the lounge at LAX and NRT ate at the lounge in NRT. NRT to PVG as usual same old business class.

NRT-KUL on old 767 in J class. Seat narrow and nothing special. Crew very senior doing things very slowly. Meal service took over 4.5hrs and really showed favouritism if you are not Japanese. Not worth the money for what JAL is charging for Premium service compared to SQ and CX.

NRT-KUL business class on old 767. Not worth the money as the seat was old and the entertainment system quite limited with old screen. The lounge in NRT was packed in the satellite and people were grabbing the food out of the servery as soon as it arrived. The service onboard was chaotic to say the least. Had to ask for something to eat with the drink. The meal service was over 4 hours. Seat not comfortable for over 8 hour flight. Seems that if you speak the language and are male you get better service as all the male business men got bags tagged first class - and this class was not available on the flight.
Frankfurt-Narita on B777. Spotless cabin. Comfy seats and superb service from very friendly flight attendants. Very good meals lots of drinks between dinner and lunch prior landing.

Paris - Tokyo Narita Boeing 777. Seats 2-3-2 and originally in the middle. Cabin crew very helpful and found me an aisle seat. Inflight service superb very personal and attentive cabin crew. Meal choice either Western or Japanese. I chose the former superb french cuisine but nearby passenger had the oriental and I wish I had chosen that. In flight entertainment AVOD and could be better - plenty of movie choice but little in the way of TV comedy sport and documentaries.

Sydney-Narita-Frankfurt in Business. Fantastic crew and ground staff professional and friendly. JAL business class seats are full flat 2-3-2 arrangement made the cabin really crowded. Sydney-Narita leg using economy headset for business class. Food was beautifully presented but not always tasty. IFE good not great after two legs you pretty much finished everything you could watch. Two first class lounges at Narita terminal 2 hardly anyone there middle of the morning. Buffet dinning spa massage fantastic but only 10 minutes.

Tokyo Hanada-Beijing-Tokyo Narita in Business class. JAL has a nice first class lounge at Hanada airport great food and drinks nice facilities but does not have spa service. Business class seat is more like Qantas domestic business class seat. Hot meal served with good choice of drinks. Cabin crew friendly and professional. AVOD system is okay does not have great range of movies. JAL uses Beijing airport first lounge at PEK pretty average for first class lounge.

SYD-NRT-FRA then CDG-HND-NGS then FUK-NRT-SYD in business class. As a JAL Mileagebank member able to select preferred seat in advance - 1st row in J class with more room. B777's to/from Australia/Japan/Europe MD90/B737-800 internally. Friendly courteous service comprehensive menu with choice of Japanese and Western options. European sectors now have an expanded on- demand 2nd meal service with about 10 options to choose from any time after first meal service. IFE improved since last year with more movies. Whilst our travel agent booked discounted JAL airpasses for Y class travel in Japan these were easily upgraded to J class at check-in for Y1000 each. Great value for the extra room. Did not use the CDG lounge due to a very tight Air France connection from FCO. Sakura lounge at NRT very comfortable with good selection of snacks and hot food especially at lunch and dinner time. Upstairs bar with barperson able to make a wide variety of drinks. Great value J fares to Europe makes JAL my preferred choice for European travel.

SYD-NRT-FRA-NRT-SYD in Premium Economy (plus NRT-SIN-NRT J Class). Excellent aspects were the meticulous cabin crew service good leg room seats which allowed sleep and quiet cabins. Not so good was the food in Premium Economy - minuscule tasteless portions of poor quality especially to and from Australia. I can recall wonderful Japanese food even in basic economy 10 years ago on JAL. An odd aspect is that JAL seemed not to be able to recognise my OneWorld Emerald details and status until I complained on check-in on each leg. Another odd aspect was the default position of having all window shades closed on boarding and even on take off and landing. Isn't this policy a safety hazard? I enjoyed the First Class Lounges at Narita Sydney (through Qantas) and at Frankfurt.

I flew with my baby who was only 2 months old when we first took JAL. The staff at the airport was nice and helped with everything including luggage. At the boarding gate the staff was also there to carry my bags and fold the stroller and put it in a thick plastic bag to protect it! On arrival Narita and JFK the staff was there to help me with luggage and also helped me carry the bags through immigration and customs.

I recently flew to Narita from LAX. I will not take JAL again. The most unpleasant part of the experience was how warm it was inside the cabin. Both my daughter and I could hardly stand it. She took off her sweater and hat and I had to get a wet towel and use it on my face and neck. I had to chew some peppermint gum to calm my stomach. Also the food was pretty bad Much of what we were offered I wouldn't touch. For the trip back we were prepared and brought food with us.

ORD-NRT Business class great looking B777 and nice interior. JAL Entertainment system stands among best airlines. Food was nice especially the curry. Sakura lounge in NRT was also very good was able to take shower and free massage chair. Business seat was bit narrow but was endurable. NRT-ICN Business class with bad service. Very interesting how different the service was from long distance routes. B767 was also outdated and old. Best of all was their punctuality. Everything was on time and felt very safe in flight.

LAX-Narita-Hanoi and would not go on JAL again. One reviewer commented on how warm the flight was and I couldn't agree more so warm I was going crazy and switched into some shorts from my carry on. Poor service as they seem to be catering to those who were Japanese. Entertainment system was old and filled with older movies and few new releases. They got me back alive and in one piece but would not take them again.

SYD-NRT. This was the 4th time I have taken this flight in the past 3 yrs. Each time the flight left and arrived on time. The quality of the flight attendants was exceptional on every flight. The grooming charm and elegance was equal to the best in the world. The personal service was most attentive and friendly. My wife left a scarf in the plane at Narita and one of the flight attendants found her in the immigration line and returned it to her. The downside is the service products. No menus or amenity packs. The entertainment system is poor the portions of food are small and the food is barely edible. The red wine is of fair quality but the white wine is almost undrinkable. As mentioned by other reviewers the cabin tends to be warm. If these female flight attendants had a quality product to offer the ranking would be equal to the top airlines.

Haneda to Seoul Gimpo Economy class. This flight from HND-GMP was my second flight on JAL since 2003. In 2003 JAL was great and I was surprised by JAL's service. However HND-GMP flight recently was just a disappointment. Warm and kind service is long gone. Instead there are lethargic FA's who can't speak either English or Korean. Meal was plain rice wasn't cooked well and coffee wasn't hot. The airport and the planes were both very humid and stuffy.

ORD-NRT on Boeing 700-300. The Economy cabin was full so they upgraded me to Premium Economy with no extra charge. The service was exceptional and the food was great. NRT-ORD in Economy. The seat wasn't as small as I expected but I'm only 5'2" so I can imagine what it would be like for someone over 6'. The service was excellent and the food was good.

Jakarta-Narita-Jakarta on B777-200 aircraft Economy class. There was no delay for either outbound or inbound flight. Cabin was so-so clean tidy and nice inflight entertainment was okay. Meal tasted very nice cabin staff were very deft and courteous. The only downside from the flight was the air conditioner felt pretty warm on CGK- NRT sector some passengers including me told the FA and problem was fixed afterwards. The other was Tokyo- Ishigaki-Naha-Tokyo with B737-400 and B747-400. No delay overall flight was so-so just a little disappointed when there was no hot meal for Tokyo-Ishigaki and Naha-Tokyo service which is a quite long domestic flight.

SYD-NRT-LHR B772 AND B773 Premium Economy. Great flights reasonable inflight catering SYD-NRT and better NRT-LHR. Good selection of alcohol. Good IFE but more recent selections would be good. Seat comfortable and plenty of leg room for a 194cm passenger especially in row 17 (bulkhead). Only downside is the noise cancelling headsets promised on the JAL website don't materialise. For the price a really good option for long haul Australia to Europe or US especially if you want a stopover in Japan.
SYD-NRT. Premium Economy. Crew hospitable. Avoid the window seat as it is still difficult to get out of. Movie selection okay although no noise cancelling headsets. Staff were respectful.
NRT-DME return. Both flights on time. Extremely good service attentive crew. Plane clean and entertainment system had a large choice of titles.

Seoul Gimpo to Tokyo Haneda. Plane was modern and clean cabin temperature comfortable. Seat back entertainment was good considering flight is only 2 hrs. Flight attendants were friendly professional and spoke adequate English. Departed and arrived on time. Only criticism would be the bento box served as lunch was too small.

Sydney to Narita then to O'Hare return in Premium Economy. I have been flying JAL regularly since 1985 and these flights were probably the worst I have experienced. Terrible seats hard tiny tilt back and no legroom under seat in front very average food and low quality Spanish wines. With an enforced stopover in Narita they have even cut out supplying breakfast. The airline is definitely going down hill.

My daughter and I flew LAX to Narita. Other reviewers have mentioned this - the air temperature in the cabin was stifling. It was so warm I felt sick. I was wearing a dress and sandals so it wasn't because I was overdressed. Nine hours of this was horrible. As was the food.

Originally flying with American Airlines from Dallas-Tokyo but due to a delay in our flight from Montreal we were rebooked with Japan Airlines from Chicago-Tokyo. From the ground staff at O'Hare Airport to the service onboard everything was great and I was very well treated by everyone. I can tell the smile and friendliness were genuine. I will continue to fly with JAL.

Sydney-Tokyo Narita-Sapporo-Tokyo Haneda then Tokyo Narita-Sydney. The seating was cramped I am 170cm and my knees were up against the seat in front my husband was much more cramped than me. The entertainment system was average - all movies started at the same time. The domestic legs were thankfully short it was actually a novelty how old the aircraft's were for these legs but the cabin crew were lovely. We tried to upgrade on the return leg but were told our ticket class was not upgradable. They didn't do anything wrong as such but didn't really do anything right either and it is just too long a flight to be that uncomfortable.

LAX-NRT-SYD premium economy. The staff were lovely very helpful. The seats were terrible my husband is 6'2" and I am 5'7" and neither of us could get comfortable. They may suit if you are under 5' but for average height and weight we found it impossible to get comfortable foot rests were too short (cut into your calf) and when the seat reclines it creates a gap at your back that makes it very hard to relax. The cabins were also very warm no airflow and food was also terrible.

Only 3 out of 9 seats occupied. Food was great as was selection of champagne and wines. The Solo Sleeper seat is nice cushions are on the hard side. The seat turns into a flat bed which is a bit narrow though. The entertainment system is good but screen in First is quite small. I prefer the bigger screen in Business. So for a day flight take business (good food excellent entertainment) and for a night flight first (good sleep after an excellent meal).

JFK-NRT in Business Class on B777-300. Exceptional service and delicious food. Seat comfort was good - not great as I found the bed position to be a bit awkward and hard to get comfortable for sleep. IFE excellent. Only real negative was the 2x3x2 configuration which would be unacceptable if I had a middle seat. Ground staff and cabin crew were attentive professional and caring.

NRT-SYD in Premium Economy. This cabin is a well-priced alternative to economy in theory contains shell-style seats good IFE etc. My biggest complaint is related to legroom. Although Premium Economy has more advertised legroom than Economy due to the presence of large metal boxes (presumably supporting the IFE) under the seat in front of me I couldn't fully extend my legs which made it hard to sleep hence negating the value proposition. I did notice these boxes throughout the cabin so suspect it wasn't just my seat. And I'm neutral to negative on the shell seat as well. Yes it is nice that nobody is reclining in your face but the slide is awkward and I don't find it terribly comfortable. Food in Premium Economy much more akin to Economy than Business. Cabin attendants were attentive warm and professional.

San Francisco to Tokyo return with our 2 month old son. They provided diapers and a bassinet for our son to sleep during the flight. The staff was very courteous and helped us before during and after the flight. We also had priority boarding because of our baby so we did not have to stay in line. They have individual TVs and the beverages are free unlike US airlines.

Sydney-Tokyo-London return. Superb flights all on time or early. High quality and professional inflight service where flight attendants seemed to be able to anticipate one's need before-hand. With the possible exception of SYD-NRT high standard of food offered throughout. The bathrooms were kept spotlessly clean and looked brand new. Good quiet first class lounge at Narita although Japan Airlines uses the BA First Class Lounge at Terminal 3 at Heathrow and this was not so good. However for the price offered this was very good value for what was overall a five star experience.

SYD-NRT-SFO return Dec 2011/Jan 2012. Premium Economy seat was not as good as I thought. The leg room was fine as I am not tall person but the seat recline was just as bad as economy. The lounge service was a bonus. The food was the same as economy and was ok. Movie selections pretty much the same as other airlines. FA's were professional polite and pleasant.

SYD-TYO-SYD. Excellent service from cabin comfort and cleanliness to food (variety and quantity) to attentive and professional cabin crew. Experienced the First Class lounge at Narita for the first time and was impressed. Good selection of food and drinks and very comfortable. Have already booked our next journey with JAL in April.

Sydney to New York via Tokyo in premium on all flights. The seat was very good and recline is decent with enough legroom. Service was excellent on the USA legs yet the Sydney routes not as good. Extra services like lounge access priority boarding and priority baggage handling make PE on JAL an excellent choice!

ORD-NRT route Executive class. Cleanliness and high quality service can be expected. Would love to see JAL compete more with entertainment: entertainment network choices are not as high as a US based airline. Food: Though quality is quite good the Western menu is pretty much steak and 1 other seafood choice. The eat any time menu seems to be the same as well over the last few years. Cabin comfort: The HVAC of aircraft is usually very warm to the point that it becomes uncomfortable for some Westerners. Other Asian airlines are becoming super competitive and I think JAL can do better.

Nagoya to Narita to connect with an international flight in J Class. Airport experience consistent efficient check-in and security and very disappointing lounges. No food on offer for this early morning departure. Boarding well organised and friendly crew. Sadly again nothing but a cold drink on offer on this 55 minute flight. Have travelled JAL a few times in Executive Class and it seems you never get anything but a cold drink in a paper cup. Connection worked well though. Sadly the lounge in Tokyo was so busy I did not get to eat there either.

B777-300ER skysleeper solo (CDG-NRT) 3A. Seat is not full flat and is uncomfortable and old. It is possible to fully extend your legs although your heel is in the air because of short seat. Inflight entertainment is good and enough to enjoy in Japanese English and Chinese. The 10 inch monitor is very small and old-fashioned. I chose Japanese cuisine and seasonal appetizers were very cold (almost frozen). A la carte menu was very good.

I had two flights - one from Beijing to Tokyo and a connecting flight from Tokyo to San Francisco. Both were excellent. Flight attendants were polite helpful and made sure blankets and pillows were available. FA's responded quickly when I needed water for medication. Meal service was excellent with good food on both flights and real silverware. Seats were more comfortable than you usually find in economy. Overall I was very pleased and will definitely fly them again.

Still at Tokyo NRT Admirals club waiting for connecting AA flight to Dallas. First leg New Delhi to Tokyo. In New Delhi after priority boarding was over everyone else was waiting when suddenly a Japanese official turned up and started moving a few people from the back of line and few late comers towards the priority entrance. He kept shouting â€“ with no one understanding and shrugged others off. Awful inflight service it seems as if staff are forced to serve passengers they want to get it done as soon as possible and don't respond to calls. I saw calls from multiple passengers left unanswered. Most of the food was ok. Twice they provided empty cup for tea/coffee as part of meal tray but my cup went empty both times. On the other hand admiral club facility at NRT proved to be a great experience. Much better than those in Chicago. After today's experience I would not travel JAL unless I am forced to.

Vancouver-Tokyo-Bangkok. The service was outstanding the food the same. The seats on these flights are outdated and have not been upgraded in years. Other airlines for the same price or lower provide better seats. It is a long trip and for the cost of a business class ticket better seats are expected and should be provided.

777 SYD-NRT and 787 HND-PEK. Food was good but not fabulous on both legs IFE was good but other carriers have a much broader selection. Where JAL truly stands out is customer service. From the moment the boarding pass is scanned at the gate to the exit onto the jetway one gets the impression that these employees care about superior service. How refreshing after the take-it-or-leave-it attitude on most US- based carriers! 787 was a nice experience with the oversized windows which darken at the touch of a button and the ride is slightly quieter than other aircraft's but cannot see that the individual passenger experience is greatly improved. My only criticism of JAL is that the cabin is kept a little warmer than I would like as others have commented - still it wasn't bad enough to deter me from flying them again.

I went on a domestic flight from OKA-HND. The flight was very comfortable. Since I was tourist in Japan I requested the air hostess to teach my daughter Japanese paper folding 'Origami' and she squatted down for 40 minutes and taught my daughter with a smile and in the end presented her with an ice-cream. The service was great for a domestic flight.

We experienced the cancellation of our flight Narita/DME. Sincere thanks exceptional service and support we received in the business lounge. The cancellation was annoying but unavoidable. Assistance and courteous support meant no hardship resulted and we arrived at our destination with gratitude.

Initial leg HNL to TOK B767. As a Sapphire Member in one world alliance the check in process at HNL was very smooth orderly and efficient. The Sakura Lounge was average but allowed for a good working environment. Boarding was also no issue. Flight attendants were very pleasant spoke fluent English and were available through out the flight. Numerous refreshments offered including soup tea water and coffee. Meal service was very good. Hot ample and tasty. AVOD system offered many options and the screen size acceptable. Aircraft was an older 767 but in good shape and comfortable. Second Leg TOK to PVG. Able to use the Sakura lounge in TOK. Very comfortable good food service as well as call brand refreshments. Boarding was again efficient and smooth. Food service quick and ample good tasting portions. Flight attendants were very nice and always available. Did not use the AVOD as a nap was certainly needed. Overall a fine experience and would certainly recommend the carrier except that they do not credit your account with 100% miles unless one is paying full coach or better fare. That's a drawback.

Traveled SFO-SIN with transit at HND. SFO-HND plane was a pretty old plane and full as well in-flight entertainment was OK. Service was generally courteous and food was pretty decent. HND-SIN on a newer more spacious plane with newer entertainment system but programme was exactly the same. It was an overnight flight and we were served breakfast a bit too early at just after 4am. Arrived half an hour ahead of time.

SIN-HND and NRT-SIN. Aircraft for both flights were new 767s with MAGIC V entertainment and new Recaro seats. Both flights departed and arrived on time. Flight to Haneda was a night flight so a little snack and drink was served before the lights were switched off for a good four hours. Breakfast was a Japanese-style omelette with rice and noodles (only one option) which I did not particularly enjoy. Staff were friendly and polite throughout. The flight from Narita to Singapore was a day flight two snacks as well as a lunch were served. Service was fantastic on this flight as well and there were two options for lunch which were both quite tasty. Inflight entertainment was average the large MAGIC V touch screen was great however there was a limited number of movies and the music selection was poor compared with that on my connecting flight to Australia with Qantas. Despite some minor drawbacks where this airline excelled was its customer service which was excellent from beginning to end. Overall my experience with JL was great and I would have no hesitation with flying them again to and from Japan.

Flew JAL from Bangkok to Tokyo on a 6-hour flight. Enough room for most people to have whole row to themselves. Pillows and blankets for everyone which were very good quality. Food was good and they served green tea. In flight entertainment was AVOD which was nice.

Nagasaki to Osaka with JAL my flight got cancelled (had to return to Nagasaki) due to tech problems. I needed this flight to catch a European connection next morning early from Osaka. In Nagasaki the ground staff of JAL went out of its way to help me. Booked another flight for me with ANA from Fukuoka to Osaka Kansai early next morning reserved a hotel for me in Fukuoka arranged a taxi to bring me to Fukuoka airport gave me money for dinner/breakfast. Things can go wrong with every carrier. But I have never seen a carrier solving a problem in such a superb way!

NRT to TPE on Thursday evening. Check in was smooth and quick at the JGC counter. The exclusive "Special Security Gate" was very convenient for Business Class and JGC passengers to pass the X-ray check. The Sakura Lounge was just outside the immigration-check counter which is convenient. The dining service was very good in the lounge and the working environment was also very well. The flight was on time. Cabin attendants were really nice. The food and services were excellent. It was overall a very nice experience.

Paris CDG - Tokyo HND. Everything went smooth from check-in to landing. The one-year old service from Paris to downtown-located Haneda airport is extremely convenient. Moreover the new Int'l terminal at Haneda is state-of-the-art and very clean. The cabin was quite old but the service and the IFE were excellent. The system is very smooth and quick and offers plenty of contents. The food was great and the large choice of drinks was refreshing. No delay great service great product friendly fares.

HKG NRT 767-300 in business class. Flight left and arrived on-time. The flight attendants were very attentive. The lunch served was very good. My wine was always topped off. The crew could not have been better. The IFE was excellent with a forward camera for take-off and landing. I had not flown JAL in a few years but was very impressed and will try them again.

My wife and I travelled London to Sydney via Narita using JAL all the way travelling Premium economy. The most disappointing aspect of the JAL flights was the very poor food - options and quality. It was substandard relative to what is available elsewhere and for the price (either in terms of FFPoints or money) of a Premium economy flight . We were disappointed. Also the in flight entertainment system gave very limited options for films. Having moved about Japan internally on occasions the food and the film options were intended more for a Japanese customer base and not for a global community of travellers.

NRT to ICN. The service was good but the cabin was outdated. The food was not great- only Japanese meal available on my flight. The portion was not generous. The duty free selections were very limited on Tokyo-Seoul route. After meal a small bottle of Japanese liquor was offered with one bag of rice snack and one bag of nuts. The flight attendants were very knowledgeable to introduce all kinds of liquors they had and kept having them coming if you wish. I ended up trying three different Japanese liquors (shochu Sake and Umeshu). I enjoyed all of them. The service manger even wrote me a small note of how to make Japanese cocktail. In short a good trip with good service but less competitive cabin product.

SYD-FUK via HND/NRT JL772/771 B777-200ER Domestic JL313 B777-200/JL3054 B737-800. FA were friendly and helpful. I also didn't expect much from the meal but actually it was nice. FA's frequently walk around and offer drinks and snacks. Inflight entertainment was of course AVOD. Flights departed on time and arrived earlier than schedule. Friendly fare and service. I will take JAL again.

TPE-NRT 14 Nov 2012. Wonderful experience. First time with JL and was impressed. The seat although it only reclines was very comfortable. In flight entertainment wasn't as good as CX. However both the on-board catering and cabin crews were fantastic. JL staff really managed to make me feel special and well looked after.

Avoid the carrier and the 787 from Boston to Tokyo. It was so bad that I would rather change planes than take the direct from Boston to Tokyo and back. 1st flight canceled (mechanical issue on 787 no parts). Spent night in airport hotel (JAL picked up tab). 2nd attempt delayed (entertainment system failed to operate). Flight leaves two hours late. No entertainment system on 14 hour flight no power for laptops/ipads seats were without power for 1/2 of trip. Land in Tokyo and I'm offered $70 compensation on $7500 round trip. Flight from Tokyo to Boston delayed boarding due to "entertainment system issues". Keep in mind this is a brand new 787 and it didn't have lay flat seats in premier class. Nearly all premier passengers were saying they would not fly the airline again.

My wife and I flew from Nagoya to Taipei on JAL. The check-in seating food and service was very good. We think the food was better than even ANA which is our preferred airline on long haul flights. I plan to fly on JAL from Nagoya to New York next year.

Business class KUL to ORD via NRT. KUL to NRT was on old 767 with seats that could not lie flat at all. The IFE was new and had a good choice of programs. Service was good. NRT to ORD on new 777-300ER with almost lie-flat seats. IFE was older that 767 flight. Food was excellent. The Japanese menu was extensive. It is catered to those used to Japanese food and the American sitting next too me could not eat most of it. Service was good and flight smooth.

SIN-HND NRT-SIN. First time on this airline. Both flights were 787-800. 2-4-2 seating configuration for economy. Check-in was fast and smooth at both SIN and NRT airports. However check-in counter staff at NRT had problems conversing in English. Flights were able to depart and arrive on time. Seats were rather cramped with barely sufficient leg space but still acceptable. Cabin attendants were attentive and respond to calls promptly. Unfortunately their English proficiency was not up to standard and most of them spoke mostly in Japanese to even non-Japanese passengers. Also despite being an international flight all the announcements were made in Japanese before English. Food was palatable which comes in a main course 2-3 side dishes and fruits. The drink menu was standard. IFE included variety of games television shows movies from various regions around the world but many of them were rather outdated. Other than the language proficiency of the staff the overall experience was good.

I flew from Tokyo to San Francisco. The seats were more packed and less comfortable than any other airline I can recall. For the first time in over 100 cross-continent flights I have taken the airline did not offer a proper meal until 6 hours after departure! Shortly after departure a sorry snack was offered - pack of nuts and a cheddar toast. Inflight entertainment was the least elaborate I have seen with small screens. The cabin crew were nice and smiley but airport staff were extremely unhelpful. I won't fly JAL again.

I took an AF code share flight from LHR JAL fight from CDG to HND. B772. Aircrarft was pretty empty in economy so managed to get a row of three to myself and stretch out. The all female crew were polite and gracious as to be expected. Eye contact and smile given at all times and each member seemed to be able to speak English fluently. Leg room in Economy wasn't great and if the plane was full it would have been a tight 11.5 hours. AVOD was average and small screens on the 777. I would fly JAL again but probably pay for the upgrade to premium.

I flew from Vancouver to Taipei via Narita. The first part of the trip was pleasant entertainment was excellent but the food was poor but edible. Staff fluent in English and Japanese which was a big improvement since 2009. The second part of the trip was very hot and stuffy. Their food on the second leg was soggy and unpleasant to eat. I will definitely take this airline again.

Very disappointed with the flight. I flew from Bangkok to Narita. Check-in was a disaster. The counter agent changed my airline and departure time without telling me about the change. I believed that I had a 3 hour wait for my flight departure whereas with the change I needed to get to the gate within 30 minutes on a different airline and I missed the flight. This meant that I had to wait 16 hours for the next flight! I finally left on JAL Flight# 718. Flight staff were very friendly. The food was all Japanese which I can not eat. The seating was very uncomfortable which made for a long flight. This is the first time that I have commented but the eighth time that I have flown on the airline.

O'Hare-Narita-Bangkok. Boeing 777 Economy from Chicago delayed due to late arrival of our American Airlines flight but still we arrived in Narita on time. Food excellent. I had travelled a few time with Japan Airlines and I noticed the food quality has increased. Staff very professional on all flights. Seat pitch is a little bit tight though. Hopefully the new economy cabin (to be available in the next few months) will provide more space. Upgraded to Premium Economy from Narita to Chicago and was quite impressed with the quality of the product (I have also travelled Business class with them a few years ago). Seat very comfortable (shell seat allowing to preserve your own space). Do not feel like going back to economy class. I will certainly fly JAL again in the near future with the new economy cabin.

Flew from New York to Osaka mid Feb in premium economy the food on both outgoing and incoming flights was awful the low point being the fried chicken sandwich! Having flown JAL in the past I was appalled by the food selection! Otherwise as usual all went well and was a comfortable flight!

JAL flight 8 from Narita to Boston 27 Feb in business. 777 substituted for grounded 787. Everything satisfactory or good but the first (main) meal service. There was simply no predictability to it. Some were served relatively quickly but we and others throughout the cabin waited 2 hours for our first drink. Couple across the aisle were served a second drink given their menus and had orders taken before we had a drink or a menu. We asked for a menu and were not given one for an hour after the first request. Food when it came was good and beautifully presented as were the other meals available on request. Once poured drinks were replenished frequently. Angled flat seat was relatively comfortable for sleep. Movie selection was disappointing compared with AA which we took from US to Tokyo.

Nagoya to New York via Narita and the check-in services were excellent. Flight was punctual excellent on- board service with great food and beverages. Return from New York on March 31st was excellent too. This is my fourth flight on JAL having flown to Taipei last year and their services are very consistent across the board. Their WI-FI on the flight was very expensive at $11 an hour! I feel that all wi-fi costs should be built into the ticket prices.

NRT-CTS in Dec 2012 with family. Retrieved bags from NRT T1 to JAL domestic terminal at NRT T2. Managed to get an upgrade to J class. Terminal was busy and we were whisked to the new B737-800 by bus. Terminal was congested and we were on the runway for an hr before take off. Seats were comfortable and we slept. Cabin crew served one round of drinks to the 80% full flight. Children were given JAL stickers. Drop down screens showed flight map. Headphones were provided for music entertainment. Return flight on same aircraft. Managed to get upgrade to J class. Check in staff was new and it took her 40 mins to check in our 4 bags + 2 strollers. To our surprise she checked in our bags all the way to Singapore even thought our flight to SIN was not under One World (Delta Airlines). Arrived on time in NRT T2 with similar inflight service provided from NRT-CTS. Aircraft's were new and J class seats with leg rests were extremely comfortable.

LHR-NRT-LHR. Flight was bumpy which was due to the weather but after eating we went through a particularly bad patch of turbulence and I became airsick. I used the supplied bag which instructed you to hand it to staff when used. I got up to dispose of it and flight attendants avoided me for 5 minutes! Eventually a female attendant came over to me and took the bag. I asked for some water. 30 minutes later still no water. My husband went and asked the hostess for the water and she told him she'd forgotten and she'd just bring it over. 10 minutes later she came over with a bottle of water by this time I was asleep anyway.

Appalling legroom. I'm statuesque and large framed and found the lack of legroom a real problem for almost 10 hours. Downgraded from premium economy when the product was withdrawn from the Sydney - Tokyo service. The domestic connection to Osaka was far more comfortable. Food was average and more for local tastes although the noodles were redeeming. Overall a very average experience.

Appalling legroom. I'm statuesque and large framed and found the lack of legroom a real problem for almost 10 hours. Downgraded from premium economy when the product was withdrawn from the Sydney - Tokyo service. The domestic connection to Osaka was far more comfortable. Food was average and more for local tastes although the noodles were redeeming. Overall a very average experience.

FRA-NRT-FRA. Business class seat rather uncomfortable. Front of the business cabin was freezing while back was too hot. Staff just did not speak English which was rather frustrating at the time. I had ordered a Gluten Free meal due to my allergy and I was starving the whole time in both directions meals were not even a snack size and just salad leaves. My main complaint would be the food I guess JAL took the food allergy as allergic to food. It was horrible! My advice: pay a bit more and fly ANA.

NRT-SYD and BKK-HND. It was my first time on this airline and I thought their service and product were extraordinary. The meals were very tasty Japanese and even served with Miso-soup. On leg between BKK-HND portions were a little small (night flight) with no meal choice. The cabin and toilets are very clean which I think is always important. AVOD was working perfectly and there were enough English options to choose from. The Crew was outstanding! They are not only correct and polite all the time but smiling and cheering as well.

NRT-PVG was excellent food and service. TPE-HND a few days later was not so good - although a 3.5hr flight the order for drink and meal was taken after takeoff and arrived together 45 mins later. No refill offered. The economy-style Japanese rice/pork dish had been ruined by re-heating leaving rice more like a biscuit pork and veg solid. When I said it was inedible they appeared surprised. An apology and hope that my next JAL flight experience will be better from manager. I wonder whether there is a different service standard in/out of HND compared to NRT.

I bought a one-way ticket on JAL at the last minute MNL-NRT-JFK for about USD 800 a great value. The flights were right on time on Boeing 767 and 777 the seating and food was very good. USB charger and stainless steel silverware were extra touches. The Asian food was very good as were the Japanese beer and French wine.

SYD-NRT NRT-LHR LHR-NRT NRT-SYD. Excellent service including food cabin crew and AVOD. Was my first experience on the new Business Skysleeper seat that reclines to 100% flat. Very comfortable and very private. Plenty of room to stretch out with lots of room in the seated position to store magazines laptop headphones etc. Ability to order meals post the first meal service using the touch screen controller on the seat. Very convenient. Excellent value as well especially when considering I was connecting to the LHR-NRT leg from Frankfurt and this flight was included as part of the original fare at no cost in J class. Will definitely fly again.

NRT to LHR on flight JL401 on 30th July economy. Check in smooth and fast. On board the seats were incredibly uncomfortable. I honestly think they had just covered the hard shell of the seat in fabric because there was so little padding but it felt like there was plenty of legroom. Customer service on board was (as expected from a Japanese airline) spectacular. I'm on a gluten free diet and the stewards who were all bilingual were extremely polite and helpful. What really impressed me on this flight was the food. Bearing in mind I was in economy I didn't expect to be served two gourmet meals (by airline standards) including a steak and red wine reduction! Although this was a special gluten free meal everyone seemed impressed with the food in general which all looked very good. Without a doubt the best food I've had on a flight including business class on BA. Other than the uncomfortable seats my major complaint is the IFE which was appalling. Only a handful of English language movies of which 4 were so-called "new releases" and only 5 of which I'd ever heard of. There wasn't a single English language TV show on board and the Japanese programming (which was plentiful) doesn't do much for a western audience. I'd consider another airline next time I fly to Japan - on a 12 hour flight the last thing I want is to run out of things to watch.

My family and I flew from Narita to JFK in July 2013. We were fortunate to have row 23 seats ABC & D on a 777-200 which is the first row past business class. Plenty of legroom which was a blessing. However the entertainment selection was rather poor especially the movie selection for our 12 + hour flight. I wish they offered a bit more choice as far as the food selection goes. I know most of the people were Japanese and they liked it but I'm not. Would I fly JAL again? If they offered the best price I certainly would.

Flight JL 074 15th July 2013. KL to Tokyo and it was probably the best journey that I've had. Cabin is very well maintained good food cabin crew very polite and the food is exceptionally good too. I am tall and I had good leg room space and overall I was very happy in choosing Japan Airlines.

HEL-NRT on 19/8/2013. The aircraft for the route was a new B787 which is quiet and comfortable as such. The service was Japanese style - extremely polite yet distant. Food in business class was a strange mix of excellent and mediocre dishes. The seat was not a very comfortable seat for a nearly 190 cm height. It was not lie flat seat and was uncomfortable for a business class seat. All in all a fine service but not great.

From Tokyo Narita to Helsinki Vantaa with a Boeing 787-800 Dreamliner. Very comfortable cabin with good seats and ambient light. Large window and large video screen. Great choice of movies to see. The service was very good very friendly staff continuously through the entire flight. Lunch and dinner were very tasty next to the good quality there was also more than enough food served. Great choice for beverages and ice cream was also being served. Aircraft was clean including the quite large and modern toilets. This was a very good flight one of the best I ever had and the flight was relatively cheap. Definitely a recommendation!

HKG-NRT-HNL R/T with a mixture of 767 recliners and 777 angled lie-flat. Service efficient and reasonably friendly. I found the seats outdated and far less comfortable than those of several Asian competitors. Briefly lost power coming into Narita which was not fun. Communication with passengers in English seems to be a challenge for the flight deck crew and seemed to be intentionally avoided. Food was generally good but nothing spectacular. The IFE on all flights was poor with limited mediocre content. All things considered JAL is barely superior to any domestic U.S. carrier but decidedly lagging behind many others on a regional and global scale.

SYD-NRT-FRA-NRT-SYD. I generally like Japan Airlines especially the exceptionally high service standards and generally good food. However on recent Premium Economy travel through from Sydney to Frankfurt and return I found the shell seats almost impossible for sleeping (were these cast-offs from the similar old Cathay Pacific seats one wonders?) and due to a promotional fare offer the PE cabin was packed with noisy passengers and became claustrophobic which tends to negate the benefits of flying PE in the first place! Also this must be the only airline I can think of that allows passengers to keep their window shades closed during the take-off and landing phases of the flight - half the cabin was in darkness from before taxiing and then for the entire flight including the landings. Isn't this a safety hazard when passengers are unable to see out of the aircraft in case of emergency? On the other hand I like the JAL First lounges in Narita and use of the Qantas First lounge in Sydney - excellent. Overall however a mixed experience saved by an upgrade to business on one sector - a different experience entirely.

Could not check in online and select a seat with my partner we were assigned seats in opposite sides of the aircraft for some odd reason - despite being on the same booking. IFE rather poor unless you are Japanese Food was ok but both mine and my partner dietary requirement were not met. All other OneWorld airlines always okay. Seats are cramped and odd. The seat reclines but in an odd angle. Cabin was really hot. Overall not that satisfied with JAL and will double check if they are covering any leg of OneWorld ticket to avoid them.

NRT-BOS SFO-HND. Both sectors were aboard the 787-800 and I must say that the service was excellent. Crew constantly moved throughout the cabin excellent large sized meals Haagen Dazs Ice Cream and a "Snack Oasis" even in Economy where you can help yourself to various drinks and cookies/ chocolates etc.. I usually only fly ANA but I will fly JAL again for sure!

PEK-HND Economy Nov 12: The flight left the gate on time but queued on the runway for almost 45 min the flight was very good JAL crew were smiling and very helpful. Food was ok but it caters more for the Asian taste the 787 dreamliner is really a great one. NRT-PEK Economy Nov 20: I tried to check my luggage directly with JAL via PEK to CAI but JAL staff said they cannot do that which is very weird! Flight departed on time B767-200. The crew again were excellent food is not to my taste and there was no choice the flight was nice seats were comfortable.
Tokyo to Honolulu one of the best staff service ever experienced. Food was very nice and well prepared. Seat and entertainment was not as strong but overall it was a very smooth and pleasant flight.

NRT-LAX. This was our last flight after a month vacation and was looking forward to experiencing the "new" FC cabin on their 777300. I was not disappointed. The new leather seats great service from the FAs and food were all fantastic. Their menus are a bit complex for me and would suggest JAL look to their OneWorld partner Cathay for ideas. The tempurpedic flat bed set-up is crazy comfortable. PJs are almost as nice as Cathay's PJs. I'll be back!

Flew from Narita to New York on JAL yesterday. The flight reconfirmed JAL as one of my favorite airlines. Traveling in economy class for some 14 hours with my wife and 16-month-old daughter was made most pleasant by the highly professional helpful and genuinely friendly crew. Unlike with carriers on this side of the globe the economy class food was actually quite good. Similarly all drinks - including champagne and cognac - were free of charge and served throughout the flight upon request. And already the check-in at Narita was a completely non- stressful event as there is a special check-in section for people traveling with children.

KMJ-HND on B738. Flight departed and arrived on time. No IFE but for Japanese radio. Seats were narrow with no lumbar support. Got served an average tasting cup of green tea but no food. Service was ok but a little overbearing. For the price paid you are better off on Jetstar Japan.

Singapore to Narita 767 1 Feb. Excellent flawless service. Very tasty food. But the servings could have been greater for a flight of nearly 7 hours. A morning flight that arrived late afternoon should have included more then one fairly small meal and a small serving of cake. IFE was OK but fairly limited. I hope the Dreamliner returns to service soon.

Flew from Narita to Singapore on 5th February 2014. Boarding was systematic considering it was a full flight. Was looking forward to flying on the 787 but they change the equipment due to the maintenance conducted on the 787 fleet. Flight departed on time. Food was ok but the cabin crew were helpful in doing several rounds of drinks throughout the flight. Seat was comfortable but the only negative point on it was the entertainment box was situated beneath the seat in front which limits the legroom. I suppose this applies to the window seats of their 767 fleet. Love the feeling of flying on the 767 as it feels roomier with less pax per row 7 abreast in the 767 compared to 9 abreast in the 777. Would fly them again.

We were involved in the aircraft congestion in Haneda Airport due to the snow storms in early February and had to suffer a flight delay of some 34 hours. Despite the fact that we were issued boarding passes and therefore considered to be transit passengers in JAL's care custody and control no assistance by way of ground staff assistance or assistance with hotels or meals. When drinks were served the stewardess was reluctant to request the passenger in front to put his seat upright as 'he was sleeping' causing inconvenience and discomfort to the passengers in the following seats. Breakfast was some sort of unrecognisable stew totally unappetising with no choice whatsoever.

Flew Business Class March 4th from LAX to SIN LAX to NRT in new business class seat was good NRT to SIN in 767. New flat seat ok but too narrow to lay down flat must be on your side. Return March 11th 767 was an old one with no lie down seats just recline which are not good. NRT to LAX seat good but service was not it was 2 hours before they asked if you wanted a drink. I don't think I will go with JAL again.

Flew ORD-NRT-ORD. We booked this flight specifically to get the Japan experience before our tour and were not disappointed. Food and service in Economy was excellent. I really appreciate the larger seats in the new 777 configuration. I'm a big man 260 and found I had ample room comfortable seat with all the inflight amenities possible. Flights were on time to the minute which we appreciate for the quick connection with AA to YYZ.

JFK-NRT JAL 005. B777-300ER - New JAL Sky Suite. Economy Class. Check in was smooth and easy at JFK. Being an AA Platinum Elite member (Sapphire leveling on One World carriers) it means an extension of preferred benefits network wide. What JAL does differently though is that it immediately includes Priority Boarding status and lounge access indication on your ticket which I found helpful and convenient. A bit of a slight negative in my praise if ever so little is that the lounge at JFK has seen better days and could use some sprucing up. I must say this was one of the most pleasurable flight experiences I've had in a long time having flown so far (14 hrs straight) and in economy class. What's impressive about what JAL's done is design a standard economy seat with comfort and practicality foremost. With a pitch of 34" this has got to be one of the most generous legrooms in coach period. JAL takes Premium Economy to the next level with a whopping 42" and a whole slew of other amenities. Meal service was also a big plus. Two full meals and a mid-flight snack were served. The initial meal after takeoff comprised of two different types of appetizers fruit salad slaw salad and your choice of entree. Very scrumptious. The meal on my return journey on a different airline Cathay Pacific was a scant offering by comparison. Inflight entertainment was fairly good though lacking a little in the variety of English language TV shows. Movies were excellent - several recently released Oscar nominated flicks were on feature. Also really enjoyed the cabin crew they were all very gracious and accommodating. Overall a very pleasurable experience.

BOS-NRT NRT-BKK BKK-NRT NRT-BOS. Jan 12 and return Mar 11. Good airport Boston Logan - one of the best! Transfer / airport at Narita was excellent. Cabin crew friendly and sincere. JAL food very poor quality. However JAL has the best coffee in the air! Very good entertainment options inflight. Seats are just big enough 5'10" / 155lbs. Smooth flight(s) very professional flight crew. Apart from the food very good airline.

HKG to NRT and return JL736/735. After not having flown with them for over 20 years I was full of expectation and it was slightly disappointing. In terms of service and courtesy they were spot on! The English proficiency level of the cabin crew was more than satisfactory contrary to other reviews claiming they were hard to be understood. The business class was disappointing due to three aspects uncomfortable out of date recliner seat with remote control on the arm rest which could easily be triggered wrongly. Average food (in portion and taste) and average AVOD. It was evident to see Japan airlines were trying to cut cost by not providing 3 course meal served separately all was served on one tray which was rather cramped. The toilet is basic with the absence of toiletries such as hand cream or cologne which is a norm for most business class. General temperature of the aircraft a bit on the warm side rather uncomfortable for the 4 hours duration. However on a positive note one could see cabin crew did their best with the limited resources they have been given. On the ground check in staffs both in HK and Japan were excellent lounge in HK was just a shared one and in Narita we used the Sakura lounge which is spacious and comfortable. All in all it was clear that Japan airlines had her golden days but is now struggling to survive so they concentrate on the longer routes and give only the very basic to short haul routes. Given the cost I shall look elsewhere.

JL 004 NRT-JFK 7 April Business Class. What a disappointment - I was thrilled when JAL put back the 18.30 flight to JFK as it makes perfect connections from many cities. I was also looking forward to going on a 787 - what a disappointment in almost all areas. The shell seat is horrible (yes they are upgrading it over the course of the year) a Mini-Pillow for sleeping one size of "flight sweater" which looked like a ladies small. The first drink not put down until we were in the air for 70 minutes - quality of the food is OK - AVOD is geared strictly towards the Japanese market - they had most of the new releases but only 4 "oldies" and about 1 hour of non-movie programming in English. There were also only 2 lavs for 60 people - there was one up front in the galley behind the cockpit but it was blocked off.

Heathrow to Haneda B777 new suites 1st class all perfect from beginning to end excellent cabin crew and very skilled staff bilingual and polite! Again full cabin but they managed to fulfil all my requirements. Will fly them again.

GMP-HND during the long holiday weekend in Korea May 3-6. We were on an ancient domestic all economy configuration 763. No business class no duty free no AVOD. Granted it's a 1.5 hour flight but it was a blast from the past. We were seated in 2C/D which would normally be business but was their special extra room seating on this plane. Seat selection was available here online for no extra charge. It was a wider cloth seat with manual buttons. Service was pleasant for an Asian legacy carrier on this route. To be honest I expected more for this high value business route. The food was a chicken and mayonnaise sandwich in a box with some rice crackers and pineapple. Very simple. We departed and arrived on time without delays. The one surprise - they put as the farthest gate in the airport. Literally. Very end of Haneda down two giant hallways that took about 15 minutes of speed walking. As we booked last minutes our tickets were extremely expensive (750$ RT) so I do feel that for the price we paid that we could've had a slightly nicer (updated equipment) experience.
Naha to Tokyo Haneda. Very courteous service IFE was limited but not too bad for a two hour flight. The refreshments were limited. Just a drink and no food.

SIN-NRT in Economy on May 26. Efficient boarding. Pushed back 10 minutes early. Friendly service but extremely average food. Good IFE. An okay experience but not as good as ANA and nowhere near as good as Singapore Airlines.

JFK-NRT return on 777-300ER in Business. Also HND-ITM return in 772 outbound and 763 inbound both in Y. First the trans-pacific legs: ground staff excellent at both JFK and NRT super fast check in polite and welcoming. Sakura Lounge in JFK fine for a business class lounge decent supply of snacks and drinks. Lounge at NRT simply fantastic excellent private showers great drinks selection and good choice of hot dining options upstairs cafeteria style. Onboard hard product for these 773s are simply the best J class in the sky right now. Lay flat bed with airweave mattress pad allows for deep restive complete sleep. Privacy of window seats is unmatched couldn't see anyone else in the cabin or any leaking daylight from opened shades. Food is stellar especially the Japanese options. Loved the dine on demand ordering through the AVOD handset. FAs polite and friendly once you engage them although I noticed they were much more vocal and consistent with Japanese pax. Now for the negatives: service a bit slow during dining was forgotten for about 45 min while others were served then finally when given food salad course was skipped and remaining courses were incomplete (no bread had to ask for utensils etc). Sorry but having to ask for your food on a $6000 revenue ticket is a bit embarrassing for all parties involved. AVOD very limited. Cabin a bit warm but not unbearable. Also outbound IFE audio didn't work power outlet at seat broken JAL Sky WiFi inoperable until I did a little creative clicking around to get the login process to work. Little qualms that were negated by the immense comfort and privacy of the hard product. Overall the best way outside of F cabin to get to Japan. Would fly again.

JFK to Narita excellent staff did not see them pay the Japanese passengers more attention and spoke very good English. Economy class was reasonable comfortable. Wifi did not work the entire flight (kept dropping). Food was average but we were fed twice with a snack in between. Pilot did a very rough landing at Narita.

Flew from Frankfurt to Tokyo (Narita) in new Business Class and it was the best I've had. Service was outstanding (like Emirates used to be) and the new seats are fantastic. Thick mattress and decent size pillow allowed 7 hours sleep which is the most I've ever had flying from Europe to Asia. Lots of storage room for glasses book iPad if you have the aisle seat. Huge TV screen and good selection of latest movies. Staff were really nice and friendly and seemed to care that the whole flight was enjoyable! Western food was OK but apparently the Japanese offering that me travelling companion chose was excellent. I will certainly try to fly to Europe via Japan in the future.

JFK-Tokyo-Hanoi and return on same route. JFK-Tokyo route both ways flew on the 787. Overall a great experience. You really can tell a difference in the climate and the windows are larger and good that you can dim them. Seats I am 5'10" 240lbs and honestly had plenty of room. My only issue with the seats is after about 5 hours the seat bottom feels really hard and uncomfortable. That is my only complaint. Service was A+. Our 7 year old got a tad airsick (used a bag). The FAs were amazing making sure she was ok. Food all acceptable. Plenty offered and if you wanted more just ask. Tokyo-Hanoi and back was 767. Again wonderful service all the way around. Seats a tad more comfortable. Inflight entertainment on all segments was fine plenty on offer. Overall first time flying JAL (usually fly CP or Korean to Asia) and would fly them again in a second.

I traveled to Tokyo with a 1 year old and a 2 year old. My wife and I were a bit concerned but the stewardesses were so wonderful and helpful with us. They really went out of their way to make the long flight from Boston a pleasure. One of their cabin crew came out and returned a pacifier and helped take our luggage to Ta-Q-bin for shipping. They gave the kids presents of snacks and let me walk the 1 year old in the back of the plane when they were not busy prepping. They just went out of their way to be so helpful when I know we were those customers with those kids.

Sydney-Narita-Paris-London-Haneda-Narita-Sydney. Excellent attentive staff. Food was good quality with ample servings. Liked the ability to order later meals and drinks via the on line system. Toilets were exceptionally clean. The seating was comfortable and of good size. The Skytrax flat bed suites were private and with the mattress were good for sleeping. We appreciated the night layover at the Nikko hotel at Narita at the end of our Sydney-Narita leg. Only disappointment was the entertainment which was a bit limited in range re movies. I would fly with them again.
Flew on Boeing 767 from SG to Haneda. Overall very good airline the only downside was that there was very limited entertainment on board flights for people who don't speak Japanese.

Flew Sydney-Tokyo-Sydney in Economy on JL772/JL771 in September. Both flights were on time. Service was absolutely excellent on both flights. The food was quite good. I didn't use the IFE. What was surprising though was the seat. I am 189 cm (6'2") tall and despite being in the middle of Row 48 on both flights I was able with a bit of wriggling to stretch my legs straight out. Makes all the difference on a long flight. All in all good flights and good value for money.

Just flown Business Class 777 SYD-NRT and 787 NRT-CDG. The Shell seats are appalling uncomfortable and no privacy at all. JAL should be completely ashamed about using them. The number of seats jammed in to Business Class was a real shock. So grateful that we can choose much better carriers in the future. We won't choose LAL again. 787 was also a complete let down all the fuss and it's just another plane. All the benefits go to the carrier in cheaper fuel costs. Not to the passengers.

HNL-NRT Flt 783. Check in was good - quick fast and even offered to escort me to lounge. Inflight service - clearly separated from the rest of the pack right here. Chief Purser immediately recognized my emerald status and escorted me to seat. Asked if I needed anything else and got my pre flight drink and no less than 45 minutes in the air drinks snacks were served. During the entire flight never intrusive smiles were sincere and were incredibly professional. Very impressed with the Thai crew who were working that flight as well. The knowledge of Japanese culture and language was incredible. Good value for the money and its very obvious JAL is working very hard to get the trust of the customers again. Hats off. The Food was excellent the entertainment was very up to date and never got bored the entire time. The NEO seats on the 787s were good as well.

Flew LAX-NRT-HKG r/t in Business. A mixed bag. The long haul between LAX and NRT features the new JAL business class suite. The seat itself is roomy and offers excellent privacy and it folds down into a comfortable flat horizontal bed. Unfortunately JAL has a tendency to overheat the cabin which interferes with sleep.
